title: About em dash
content:
Hi,  
I've seen somewhere (I'm sorry to be so vague, but I really can't remember where) a letterhead that used an em dash — between every paragraph of the "contact list", like this:

My Name  
My job  
What I do  
—  
My street  
My zip code  
My city  
—  
Etc  
Etc  
Etc

Is it a typographical habit? Or some original way to use the em dash?
author: Bezier Abuser

comments.content:
I'd say they were simply using the em-dash as a separator rule.  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Personal Art and Design Portal of Ivan Gulkov  
 [www.ivangdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021023907/http:/www.ivangdesign.com/ "www.ivangdesign.com")
Simply a minimalistic style. you can use just white space (nothing), dots, dashes, single dashes, whatever you want, basically whatever is most pleasing to the eye for the specific application.
